Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the refusal of the H&C application was reasonable and procedurally fair
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) and Regulations
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Limited evidence provided by applicant regarding situation in Kenya
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to justify exceptional relief
Crimes.Legal_Rule: H&C decisions are discretionary; court reviews for reasonableness and procedural fairness
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: No interview requested by applicant or counsel
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Request for permanent residence on H&C grounds
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Procedurally fair; no duty to interview
Key_Evidence_Considered: Best interests of child not sufficiently demonstrated
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Discretionary humanitarian and compassionate considerations under IRPA
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Challenged reasonableness and fairness of refusal
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Refusal based on insufficient evidence and regulatory bar
Crimes.Decision_Authority: Second Secretary, Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Non-accompanying dependent of Canadian permanent resident
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Ineligibility due to non-disclosure of dependent

Crimes.Violation_Type: Failure to disclose dependent during immigration application
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether non-disclosure bars sponsorship and whether H&C exemption applies
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) and Regulations
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant’s mother did not declare her as a dependent upon landing
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Refusal of H&C application due to regulatory bar
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Permanent residence through family sponsorship with H&C exemption
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Mother failed to disclose applicant as dependent
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Seeking exemption from sponsorship inadmissibility on H&C grounds
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Sufficient evidence required to justify exemption from regulatory bar
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Strength of H&C factors, including best interests of the child
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: IRPA and Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: No procedural unfairness found; no interview required
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not central; focus on sufficiency of evidence
Crimes.Application_Basis: Exemption from sponsorship inadmissibility under H&C grounds
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Sparse evidence on hardship and best interests of child
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Failure to disclose dependent results in ineligibility unless H&C relief granted
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient evidence to overcome regulatory bar
Crimes.Cause_Description: Mother’s failure to disclose applicant as dependent during initial immigration
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Reviewed documentary submissions without oral hearing
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Lack of detailed evidence on conditions in Kenya and best interests
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Mother lawfully obtained permanent residence but failed disclosure duty
Crimes.Misrepresentation_Element: Omission constitutes failure to disclose, not active misrepresentation
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No justification for exemption due to lack of compelling evidence
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Second Secretary, Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Sparse and general evidence on hardship
